To do so, implements `Clone` for `OnUpgrade`.

title: feat(lib): missing Timer will warn or panic

If a default timeout is set, and no Timer, a warning will be emitted.

If a timeout is configured by the user, and no Timer is set, it will panic.

Closes #3393

title: Fixed typo in changelog
body: I fixed a typo that I found with [`typos`](https://github.com/crate-ci/typos) in the changelog.

title: chore(dependencies): disable unused futures-util alloc feature
body: `futures-util`'s `alloc` feature seems not to be used.

title: chore(dependencies): use form_urlencoded crate directly
body: As `hyper`'s example uses `url` crate just for the re-exported `form_urlencoded`, seems to be able to use it directly.

title: chore(ffi): change hyper.h to only include first line of docs
body: This will let us write much more documentation per item without worrying about increasing the size of the hyper.h header file.

title: Update http dep to 0.2.7
body:
This is required to use HeaderName::from_static in a const.

Without this, I was getting the following error:

```
RUSTFLAGS="--cfg hyper_unstable_ffi" cargo rustc --features client,http1,http2,ffi --crate-type cdylib
...
error[E0015]: cannot call non-const fn `http::header::HeaderName::from_static` in constants
  --> src/proto/h2/mod.rs:39:5
   |
39 |     HeaderName::from_static("keep-alive"),
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: calls in constants are limited to constant functions, tuple structs and tuple variants

error[E0015]: cannot call non-const fn `http::header::HeaderName::from_static` in constants
  --> src/proto/h2/mod.rs:40:5
   |
40 |     HeaderName::from_static("proxy-connection"),
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
   |
   = note: calls in constants are limited to constant functions, tuple structs and tuple variants
```

I suspect part of the reason I was getting this error is that I had a development directory sitting around from months ago, meaning the Cargo.lock was pinning an older version of `http`.

https://github.com/hyperium/http/compare/v0.2.6..v0.2.7

title: feat(client): allow `!Send` IO with HTTP/1 client
body:
This removes the requirement of the IO type from being `Send` for the HTTP/1 client connection. To do so, the ability to perform `hyper::upgrade`s had to be moved to a separate type which does require the `Send` bound. This mirrors how the server types do it.

The `Connection` type now has a `with_upgrades()` method to convert.

Closes #3363

BREAKING CHANGE: If you use client HTTP/1 upgrades, you must call
  `Connection::with_upgrades()` to still work the same.

title: FFI: fix deadlock in hyper_executor::poll_next
body:
poll_next locks the driver, and also calls drain_queue while holding that lock. Since drain_queue locks the driver too, that results in a deadlock.

To fix, unlock the driver before calling drain_queue.

Fixes #3369.

title: refactor(common): move compat constructor to method
body: This is a small refactoring. The constructor of `Compat` has been defined as an independent function, `compat`. As its name is the same of the module name `compat`, which the constructor function belongs to, it seems a little bit complicating. Moving it to the method reduces the re-export of the function as well. It might slightly improve readability.

title: docs(client,server): added note about stability of Builder struct default options
body: Completes #3336

title: fix(client): panic when pool idle timeout set to zero
fix(http2): change default server max concurrent streams to 200
body:
Closes #3358 

BREAKING CHANGE: This is a behavioral change. Consider setting your own
  maximum.

Remove outdated FIXME comments, and resolve FIXME regarding usage of `MaybeUninit`.

Since hyper's MSRV is higher now, we can use some new stabilized apis. I also removed some `unsafe` blocks related to `MaybeUninit` usage.

title: refactor(common): remove common re-export
body: There have been mix of the way of using these types, both re-exported and direct using. This pull request proposes to use them directly consistently as using re-exported ones consistently seems to be difficult and using them directly seems simple.

title: Upgrade minimum tokio to 1.13

title: refactor(lib): resolve unused warning
body: Adds `cfg` feature attributes to resolve unused warnings, which occur in each features and the combinations, and ci config to check `unused_imports` and `dead_code`.

title: refactor(dependencies): move optional dependencies to optional section
body: This might improve readability.

title: chore(ci): use cargo-hack --no-dev-deps option to check without dev-dependencies
body: `cargo-hack` has `--no-dev-deps` option to check without dev-dependencies. As this does not require nightly Rust version, the features checks are allowed to be performed with stable Rust by using this instead of `-Z avoid-dev-deps`.

title: refactor(rt): replace futures_util::Future with std::future::Future
body: `std::future::Future` could be used at these places.

title: chore(dependencies): move httparse to http1 feature
body: As `hyper::error::Parse` is a private type, `httparse` crate seems to be only used in http1 feature actually. Therefore `httparse` might be able to be moved to http1 feature.

title: chore(common): replace Never with Infallible
body: `hyper` might be able to use `std::convert::Infallible` to describe the error which never happens, instead of `hyper::common::never::Never`.

title: chore(ci): update ci config

- Updates to `actions/checkout@v4` from version 3.
- Replaces `actions-rs/install` with `taiki-e/cache-cargo-install-action` as the former is not maintained and throws warnings.

body: `httpdate` and `want` are used in some combinations of features. Although Cargo does not provide such a combined features configuration, the scopes could be reduced.

title: feat(upgrade): introduce tracing as an optional unstable feature
body:
This change allow users to opt out of tracing via the `tracing` crate by adding tracing as an optional feature. This change is part of the effort, outlined in #2874, to reach hyper 1.0.

Closes #3319
BREAKING CHANGES: tracing is disabled by default and requires users to opt in to revert to previous behavior.

title: docs(server): polish server connection docs
body:
This PR aims to address some of the tasks in https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3067, specifically:

> conn module: mention hyper-util providing an AutoConnection and builder

>  struct conn::http1::Connection: Explain that this is returned from Builder::serve_connection, and that it is essential an impl Future that must be polled (or awaited) for anything to happen.

The change in service is to make it an automatic link, which was suggested by cargo doc.

The changes have been tested by running `cargo doc --features "server,http1,client,http2" --open` and inspecting the docs.

Feedback on phrasing or if anything should be expanded on is most welcome!

title: chore(dependencies): remove implicit features of optional dependencies
feat(error): `Error::source()` is purposefully unspecified
body:
Document that the exact types returned in the erased errors of `Error::source()` may change at any moment, and cannot be depended on.

Closes #2843

BREAKING CHANGE: Do not build any logic depending on the exact types of
  an `Error::source()`. They are only for debugging.

title: chore: Replace matches crate with std assert and matches macro
body: Replaces `matches` crate with std `assert` and `matches` macro.

title: chore(dependencies): Allow socket2 0.5
body: Allows users to use `socket2` 0.5 version. When users want to use `tokio` which version is larger than 1.30, as it starts to use `socket2` 0.5, users depend on multiple versions of `socket2`, 0.4 and 0.5. According to the [changelog](https://github.com/rust-lang/socket2/blob/v0.5/CHANGELOG.md#050), as `hyper` 0.14 seems not to be affected by the `socket2`'s breaking changes, `hyper` might be able to allow users to use `socket2` 0.5.

title: feat(error): change `Display for Error` to only print top error
body:
hyper's `Error` used to print the error source automatically, preferring to provide a better default for users who do not know about `Report`. But, to fit better with the wider ecosystem, this changes the format to only print the hyper `Error` itself, and not its source.

Closes #2844

BREAKING CHANGE: The format no longer prints the error chain. Be sure to
  check if you are logging errors directly.

  The `Error::message()` method is removed, it is no longer needed.

  The `Error::into_cause()` method is removed.

body: Updates to `actions/checkout@v4` from version 3.

I wanted to have graceful shutdown after a timeout in my server application.  There is not an existing example that does exactly this.

This is mostly the existing `hello.rs` example with graceful shutdown added.

Thanks!

labels.name: B-breaking-change
labels.description: Blocked: this is an "API breaking change".

body: This removes the `from_bytes_unchecked()` method, since it's utility seems dubious (we can always add back if it's badly needed). It also makes `from_static` a const fn.

title: fix(server): Respect Expect header only when http proto > 1.0
body:
1. fix server Expect handling(from the perspective of server correctness)
    Refer to: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9110.html#name-expect
    > A server that receives a 100-continue expectation in an HTTP/1.0 request MUST ignore that expectation
3. adds HTTP/1.0 Expect 100-continue test

title: fix(http2/client): avoid double-polling a Select future
body:
This reworks http2 client connection task in order to avoid storing a `Select` future. Under some scheduling cases the future was polled multiple times, resulting in runtime panics:

```
thread 'main' panicked at 'cannot poll Select twice', /index.crates.io/futures-util-0.3.28/src/future/select.rs:112:42
stack backtrace:
[...]
   5: <futures_util::future::select::Select<A,B> as core::future::future::Future>::poll
   6: <hyper::proto::h2::client::H2ClientFuture<B,T> as core::future::future::Future>::poll
[...]
```

Closes: https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3289

title: docs(ffi): add unstable feature flag to module in docsrs
feat: add local addr getter to server builder
body: Closes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3272.

body: I am sorry if i missed those in #3184

title: fix(http1): http1 server graceful shutdown fix
body:
This is from #3233, I've fixed up the failing test.

---

fix issue in the graceful shutdown logic
which causes the connection future to hang
when graceful shutdown is called prior to any
requests being  made. This fix checks to see
if the connection is still in its initial state
when disable_keep_alive is called, and starts the
shutdown process if it is.


Closes #2730

title: chore(ci): check C header file with stable rust
fix(http1): send error on Incoming body when connection errors
body:
If a connection has any error besides reading, a streaming body sometimes wouldn't be notified. This change makes it so that when a connection task is closing because of any error, an existing body channel is also notified.

Closes #3253

title: Cargo fmt workaround
body: `cargo fmt` does not work for all files. This adds the same workaround as in [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/blob/master/.github/workflows/ci.yml#L498)

title: fix(http1): properly end chunked bodies when it was known to be empty
body: Closes #3252

title: fix(client): Do not strip `path` and `scheme` components from URIs for HTTP/2 Extended CONNECT requests
body:
As per [RFC 8441](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8441#section-4):

> On requests that contain the :protocol pseudo-header field, the
      :scheme and :path pseudo-header fields of the target URI (see
      [Section 5](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8441#section-5)) MUST also be included.

I was trying to implement WebSocket handshake based on HTTP/2 Extended CONNECT. The current implementation crafted a request which was considered invalid by the server (HAProxy 2.8):

![image](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/assets/5270106/6157bc77-8bb6-47aa-936d-275dd4af761c)

Compared to the [example](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8441#section-5.1) illustrated in RFC 8441, the pseudo headers `:scheme` and `:path` were missing.

After the fix, the client could successfully establish a WebSocket tunnel to the server.

![image](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/assets/5270106/80ebc989-7e2b-4720-870e-9fcdec22faea)

title: chore(dependencies): update to pretty_env_logger 0.5

Updated all remaining incorrect guide links that I was able to find with ctrl+shift+f 👀.

At some point it will be appropriate to update the site to forward `/guide` to 1.0 instead of 0.14.

https://github.com/hyperium/hyperium.github.io/blob/c94a621c2b95a4a824194e20da031d8cf7f1ce05/_legacy/index.md?plain=1#L1-L7

... perhaps when 1.0 lands 🤔 

# Criticism Welcome 😄

Always

title: feat(rt): replace IO traits with hyper::rt ones
body:
This replaces the usage of `tokio::io::{AsyncRead, AsyncWrite}` in hyper's public API with new traits in the `hyper::rt` module.

Closes #3110 

## Before merging

- [x] Determine naming (`AsyncRead` vs `Read`; `ReadBuf` and `ReadBufCursor`)
- [x] Determine minimal public methods for `ReadBuf` and `Cursor`
- [x] Document the types and methods
- [x] Prove that it is forwards-compatible with completion-based IO

title: docs(examples): update dependencies (#3099)
body:
# Overview

As discussed: #3099. This PR includes:

- updating dependencies to hyper 1.0
- linking to hyper 1.0 guides
- fixes for spelling and formatting

# Method

Copied every example into a fresh project and tallied all of the necessary dependencies. Then I referenced [hyper's toml file](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/blob/master/Cargo.toml) and copied the master branch dependency versions.

# Testing

Tested by dropping the new batch of dependencies into a freshly gen'd cargo project and copying in every example in turn and making sure it runs.

Tested on:

`rustc 1.69.0 (84c898d65 2023-04-16)`

Which now gives me pause in regard to MSRV 🤔. Perhaps not, since this is a version specific update.

# Criticism Welcome 😄 

I will make any necessary changes to this work to achieve the desired results 👍🏻

title: refactor(service): change Service::call to take &self
body:
change Service::call to take &self instead of &mut self. Because of this change, the trait bound in the service::util::service_fn and the trait bound in the impl for the ServiceFn struct were changed from FnMut to Fn. This change was decided on for the following reasons:
- It prepares the way for async fn, since then the future only borrows &self, and thus a Service can concurrently handle multiple outstanding requests at once.
- It's clearer that Services can likely be cloned
- To share state across clones you generally need Arc<Mutex<_>> that means you're not really using the &mut self and could do with a &self

This commit closses issue: #3040
BREAKING CHANGE: The Service::call function no longer takes a mutable reference to self. The FnMut trait bound on the service::util::service_fn function and the trait bound on the impl for the ServiceFn struct were changed from FnMut to Fn

title: fix(example): change suggestion for windows compatability
body:
# Overview

Updated echo example service root path instructions to work for Windows users out-of-the-box.

# Inspiration

Tripped over this during some midnight coding 😵‍💫

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46393653/236380212-216ea0b4-ec40-483f-8ee7-a9c628aea5bd.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46393653/236380227-ad21bb27-19c9-47f6-9eb3-83a9d7f70880.png)

# Testing

I put this change through a full loop[^1] of testing on:

- macbook (apple silicon)
- pc (windows 10, x86_64)
- linux ([devcontainer.json](https://pastebin.com/9iF6KzRQ))

No regressions discovered.

# Criticism Welcome 😄 

If bypassing the reporting step was inappropriate, I will abandon this PR and create an issue accordingly 👍🏻 

[^1]: repeating the process pictured above

title: chore(dependencies): use futures-core via futures-util consistently
body: `hyper` has already used `futures-core` via `futures-util` at many places. We could reduce some costs to maintain dependencies by doing it consistently.

title: docs(rt): make purpose of `Executor` trait clearer
body: Make the purpose of `Executor` clearer by explaining why it is necessary.

title: docs(rt): fix executor example
body: Copy pasting the tokio executor example doesn't work because the struct doesn't implement clone. This PR adds `#[derive(Clone)]` to the example.

title: avoid allocating date header for each http2 req
body: Improves the date caching logic so that for HTTP/2, the `Date` header value doesn't need to allocate (`HeaderValue::from_bytes`) for every response, and instead only once per second per thread (when `CachedDate::render` is called). With this change, each HTTP/2 response only clones the pre-rendered `HeaderValue` which is simply an atomic ref count bump on the underlying `Bytes` value.

title: chore(ci): replace actions-rs with run and use taiki-e/install-action or taiki-e/cache-cargo-install-action
body:
- Replaces actions actions-rs/cargo with run. As it is unmaintained, it warns `Node.js 12 actions are deprecated.`
- Uses taiki-e/install-action, which installs tools without building them and taiki-e/cache-cargo-install-action, which caches the built binaries. These actions save ci time to install tools.

title: use HeaderName::from_static in strip_connection_headers
body: Similar story as in https://github.com/hyperium/h2/pull/675, I'm chasing "low hanging fruit" optimizations to try and reduce the overall footprint of HTTP/2 request/response handling.

title: h2: add max_pending_accept_reset_streams configuration option
body: This allows users to set the configuration option from https://github.com/hyperium/h2/pull/668.
